bundle.name: vpn_server

description.p: The OpenVPN bundle is used to secure public connections between computers. If you have a secure LAN then you do not need to install OpenVPN at all. (i.e. a secure LAN is a LAN that only your computers have access to.)
The OpenVPN creates a network of computers to communicate through a safe, encrypted tunnel (Server Side) rendering a public LAN secure.

An OpenVPN server is used to setup a computer that allows connections and accepts connections. Servers are a bottle neck, however, you can install the server multiple times and in effect make it work in a failsafe manner.

field.label: Organization Unit

field.description: Two letter abbrieviation for the name of your country (e.g. 'US' stands for 'United States').

bundle.postinst:
# Clear out the easy-rsa dist just in case rm -rf /etc/openvpn/easy-rsa
# get the default RSA key data cp -r /usr/share/easy-rsa /etc/openvpn/.
# Generate the Diffie-Hellman parameters openssl dhparam -out /etc/openvpn/dh2048.pem 2048
# Setup the keys as defined by the user in the installation form sed \ -e "s/KEY_CN=\".*\"/KEY_CN=\"$BUNDLE_INSTALLATION_COMMON_NAME\"/" \ -e "s/KEY_ORG=\".*\"/KEY_ORG=\"$BUNDLE_INSTALLATION_ORGANIZATION\"/" \ -e "s/KEY_OU=\".*\"/KEY_OU=\"$BUNDLE_INSTALLATION_ORGANIZATION_UNIT\"/" \ -e "s/KEY_CITY=\".*\"/KEY_CITY=\"$BUNDLE_INSTALLATION_CITY\"/" \ -e "s/KEY_PROVINCE=\".*\"/KEY_PROVINCE=\"$BUNDLE_INSTALLATION_PROVINCE\"/" \ -e "s/KEY_COUNTRY=\".*\"/KEY_COUNTRY=\"$BUNDLE_INSTALLATION_COUNTRY\"/" \ -e "s/KEY_EMAIL=\".*\"/KEY_EMAIL=\"$BUNDLE_INSTALLATION_EMAIL\"/" \ /usr/share/easy-rsa/vars >/etc/openvpn/easy-rsa/vars
# Now create the RSA CA key cd /etc/openvpn/easy-rsa . ./vars ./clean-all ./pkitool --initca
# Now create the server key and copy it in ./pkitool --server server /etc/openvpn/easy-rsa/keys/{server.crt,server.key,ca.crt} /etc/openvpn/
# Start the server systemctl start openvpn@server
